The Struthers City School District has extended the open enrollment application deadline for the 2020-21 school year until August 2020. Applications will be accepted for students in grades K through 9; and must be returned to the Struthers Board of Education office.

Any student living in the State of Ohio and entering grades K through 9, is eligible. In order to be considered for open enrollment, applications must be completed in its entirety. One application must be completed for each student.

Completed applications can be returned by scanning and emailing them to kathy.evans@strutherscityschools.org; faxing to 330-750-5516; mailing to Struthers City Schools, 99 Euclid Avenue, Struthers, OH 44471. Appointments can also be made by calling 330-750-1061, ext. 41213 to drop off an application in person.
Due to existing constraints on staffing, scheduling and/or classroom space at Struthers City Schools, the following programs are currently not accepting applications in the following grades or programs: grades 10, 11, 12 and Special Education Programming.
Click the link below to download the Struthers Open Enrollment Application and the Athletic Eligibility Form:
SCS Open Enrollment Application for the 2020-21 School Year
If you are in need of additional information, please call the Board Office at (330) 750-1061, ext. 41213.

A virtual spring senior night will take place on Friday, April 24th at 8:20 p.m. Students are invited to join their classmates by clicking the link below. See everyone soon! Virtual Spring Senior Night - Read More

The Struthers Board of Education will hold its regular meeting of the board of education on Tuesday, April 21st at 4:30 p.m. The meeting will be held in the Struthers High School Cafeteria, located at 111 Euclid Avenue. Due to the current health situation, the meeting with be held remotely. We encourage everyone to view the meeting via the live stream link, which will be available prior to the start of the meeting. CLICK HERE TO… Read More

Due to the closure of school buildings to students during the COVID-19 pandemic, the District has personal protective equipment that is not currently needed for school use. Given the Governor’s request for donations of PPE due to the shortage of PPE for medical personnel and emergency responders, the District is donating its PPE for that purpose.The district is continuing to monitor the situation closely. For more information regarding the… Read More

Parents, your child's supplies will be available for pickup Tuesday, May 5th - Friday May 8th at the following locations around the building. The new packets for Kindergarten, 1st, and 2nd will be available, as well as a crate for the return of library books, at the designated locations. We will be using each wing of the school. Please send only one person from each family to the area located at each wing, while maintaining social distancing. Weather… Read More

div.h3: We Want to See Your Photos in the Yearbook!
div.p: Calling all high school students! Do you want to see your photos in the yearbook? We are looking for students to share their photos with us for printing the SHS yearbook. Click the image below to share your pictures *(the code is cats)* or email them to patricia.romeo@strutherscityschools.org. Read More

Parents, thank you for your continued support. Below you will find the assignments, both new and old, for your child to complete. Each grade level has specific work, followed by work from their special teachers (art, music, physical education and technology). The new work below was picked up in district on Tuesday, April 7th and Wednesday, April 8th. Please contact your child's teacher with any questions. We will continue to keep this… Read More

Our district is now offering an opportunity for students to earn a Seal of Biliteracy on their electronic transcripts. This seal applies to students who are proficient in two or more languages, one of those being English, and within 15 months of graduation. A student can benefit from the Seal of Biliteracy in future employment and post high school endeavors. The requirements to earn the Seal can vary, so please contact an SHS guidance counselor for more specific information or you may visit the ODE Seal of Biliteracy webpage at ODE Seal of Biliteracy.

div.h4: Struthers City School District Mission Statement
div.p: Struthers City Schools will serve our community by offering rigorous, diverse and quality learning opportunities while developing the abilities of each child so they become independent, life-long learners who positively impact society.
div.h4: Struthers City School District Vision Statement
div.p: Struthers City Schools, raising expectations through innovation and collaboration.
